sources.title: Ghost City (1932) BILL CODY
sources.description:
Stars: Bill Cody, Andy Shuford, Helen Foster
Director: Harry L. Fraser

A newspaper editor plans to expose a local crook and his gang, but things really get crazy when news of a gold strike causes the town to empty.

TRIVIA: Born William Joseph Cody on January 5, 1891, in St. Paul, Minnesota, he became a popular cowboy star during the 1920s and 1930s. Cody is often associated with the B-Western genre, where he played the heroic cowboy figure, a staple of American cinema during that period.

metadata.Plot: Newspaper editor Bill Temple arrives in Boom Town planning to expose Jim Blane as a crook. When Blane's henchman Buck fails to kill Temple, Blane prepares to flee with his money. But a sudden announcement of a gold strike empties the town. Blane heads after his henchmen who have taken his money and Temple heads after Blane.
metadata.Writer: Harry L. Fraser, Wellyn Totman, George Arthur Durlam
metadata.Actors: Bill Cody, Andy Shuford, Helen Foster
